title.narrative: Strategic advice to the Vietnamese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development on river training and management in the Mekong Delta

description.narrative: The Vietnamese Disaster Management Authority (VDMA, part of MARD) is responsible for the implementation of the World Bank funded sub-project under the Mekong Delta Integrated Climate Resilience and Sustainable Livelihoods Project (ICRSL)RVO intends to hire a team of experts to provide strategic and technical advice to this river training sub-project, funded by World Bank and managed by the Vietnamese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD). RVO aims to support the Vietnamese government and specifically the Viet Nam Disaster Management Authority as well as the World Bank on river training and river management in the Mekong Delta. This will be done by sharing international experience on riverbank erosion and sedimentation research, technical surveys and modelling approaches as well as common menus of technical, biological and “soft” measures that are appropriate to the Mekong Delta situation and may be applied in the Mekong Delta’s river branches. This assignment aims to demonstrate added value of Dutch support to the VDMA Mekong Delta river training research and master planning project with international experience on preventative measures and erosion responses, related research methodologies, as well as more broadly river training and management. The VDMA (MARD) project should be complemented with international experiences, so not only experiences in the Rhine, Meuse, Scheldt delta but also from other areas, that are appropriate for the Mekong river and deltaic branches / estuaries, including field research and modelling approaches and actual river training measures.
